730791f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [East River.]
730791f-a.text:
The newest bridge across the East River, New York City This 1,000 foot span, the longest arch in the world, is over the dangerous channel at Hell Gate. Long Island City (a part of greater New York) is on the right of the picture, with wards Island on the left. The structure turns, crosses the island, passes over water again to Randall's Island and finally reaches the mainland in the Borough of the Bronx. Jt is wholly a railroad bridge, part of a six mile road connecting the Pennsylvania and New Haven Systems and permitting through freight and passenger service between New England and the Sodth. The structure was formally dedicated on ~arch 9, took four years to build and cost 127,O00,00O. lIt makes the fifth bridge across the East River all except the Brooklyn Bridge have been opened in the last
twelve years.
April, 1917 American Press Assn.
730791f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730797f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [Bronx - Queensborough.]
730797f-a.text:
Hell Gate Bridge, showing the approach from the Bronx, spanning Ward's Island, with the Queensborough end at the right. The bridge is the rail link between the Penn. R.R. Terminal in Manhattan and the New England lines. The main span of the Bridge is 1016 ft. long and 300 ft. above high water
mark. The cost of the bridge was $25,000,000.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.
730797f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730813f-b.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [The bridge begins at Port Norris, Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria, Queens.]
730813f-b.text:
(1)
Hell Gate Bridge spans the notorious channel, called Hell Gate; at the convergance of Long Island Sound and the East River. The seething whirlpools and conflicting currents, made it extremely unnavigable; sinking many vessels, and drowning innumerable men: hence the name. The bridge begins at Port Morris in the Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria in Queens. It is one of the classics of modern achievement, being the world's longest continued span. The eastern railway tnterests combined to build it, and completed it in 1917.
July 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
730813f-b.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

730813f-a.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [The bridge begins at Port Norris, Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria, Queens.]

The seething whirlpools and conflicting currents, made it extremely unnavigable; sinking many vessels, and drowning innumerable men: hence the name. The bridge begins at Port Morris in the Bronx, spanning Ward's and Randall's Islands, to Astoria in Queens. It is one of the classics of modern achievement, being the world's longest continued span. The eastern railway tnterests combined to build it, and completed it in 1917.
July 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
730813f-a.folder: Hell Gate Bridge, New York, N.Y.

July 17, 1936.

730814f-b.title: Bridges - Hell Gate Bridge - [East River.]
730814f-b.text:
Hellgate Bridge: Three views of the railroad bridge across the East River, seen from Astoria Park, Queens.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: July 17, 1936
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2,3: June 24, 1937
